==Events==
*  [[62]] &ndash; [[62 Pompeii earthquake|Earthquake]] in [[Pompeii]], Italy.
* [[756]] &ndash; [[An Lushan]], leader of a [[An Lushan rebellion|revolt]] against the [[Tang Dynasty]], declares himself emperor and establishes the [[Yan (An-Shi)|state of Yan]].
*[[1576]] &ndash; [[Henry IV of France|Henry of Navarre]] [[:wikt:abjure|abjures]] Catholicism at [[Tours]] and rejoins the Protestant forces in the [[French Wars of Religion]].
*[[1597]] &ndash; A group of early [[Kirishitan|Japanese Christians]] are [[Twenty-six Martyrs of Japan|killed]] by the new government of [[Japan]] for being seen as a threat to Japanese society.
*[[1631]] &ndash; [[Roger Williams (theologian)|Roger Williams]] emigrates to [[Boston]].
*[[1778]] &ndash; [[South Carolina]] becomes the second state to ratify the [[Articles of Confederation]].
*[[1782]] &ndash; [[Spain|Spanish]] defeat [[United Kingdom|British]] forces and [[Invasion of Minorca (1781)|capture]] [[Minorca]].
*[[1783]] &ndash; In [[Calabria]] a [[1783 Calabrian earthquakes|sequence of strong earthquakes]] begins.
*[[1810]] &ndash; [[Peninsular War]]: [[Siege of Cádiz]] begins.
*[[1818]] &ndash; [[Charles XIV of Sweden|Jean-Baptiste Bernadotte]] ascends to the thrones of [[Sweden]] and [[Norway]].
*[[1849]] &ndash; [[University of Wisconsin-Madison]]'s first class meets at [[Madison Female Academy]].
*[[1852]] &ndash; The [[Hermitage Museum]] in [[Saint Petersburg]], [[Russia]], one of the largest and oldest museums in the world, opens to the public.
*[[1859]] &ndash; [[Wallachia]] and [[Moldavia]] are united under [[Alexander John Cuza]] as the [[Danubian Principalities|United Principalities]], an autonomous region within the [[Ottoman Empire]], which ushered the birth of the modern [[Romania]]n state.
*[[1869]] &ndash; The largest [[alluvial]] [[gold]] nugget in history, called the "[[Welcome Stranger]]", is found in [[Moliagul, Victoria]], [[Australia]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; King [[Leopold II of Belgium]] establishes the [[Congo Free State|Congo]] as a personal possession.
*[[1900]] &ndash; The [[United States]] and the [[United Kingdom]] sign a treaty for the [[Panama Canal]].
*[[1909]] &ndash; Belgian chemist [[Leo Baekeland]] announces the creation of [[Bakelite]], the world's first synthetic [[plastic]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Hellenic Air Force|Greek military aviators]], [[Michael Moutoussis]] and [[Aristeidis Moraitinis (aviator)|Aristeidis Moraitinis]] perform the first [[Naval Aviation|naval air]] mission in history, with a [[Farman MF.7]] hydroplane.
*[[1917]] &ndash; The [[1917 Constitution of Mexico|current constitution]] of [[Mexico]] is adopted, establishing a [[federal republic]] with powers separated into independent executive, legislative, and judicial branches.
*  1917   &ndash; The [[Congress of the United States]] passes the [[Immigration Act of 1917]] over [[President of the United States|President]] [[Woodrow Wilson]]'s veto. Also known as the ''Asiatic Barred Zone Act'', it forbade immigration from nearly all of south and southeast [[Asia]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Stephen W. Thompson]] shoots down a German airplane. It is the [[first aerial victory by the U.S. military]].
*  1918   &ndash; {{SS|Tuscania|1914|6}} is torpedoed off the coast of Ireland; it is the first ship carrying American troops to Europe to be torpedoed and sunk.
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[Charlie Chaplin]], [[Mary Pickford]], [[Douglas Fairbanks]], and [[D.W. Griffith]] launch [[United Artists]].
*[[1924]] &ndash; The [[Royal Greenwich Observatory]] begins broadcasting the hourly time signals known as the [[Greenwich Time Signal]] or the "BBC pips".
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[Franklin Delano Roosevelt|Franklin D. Roosevelt]] proposes a plan to enlarge the [[Supreme Court of the United States]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; Generalísimo [[Francisco Franco]] becomes the 68th "''Caudillo de España''", or Leader of [[Spain]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] forces begin the [[Battle of Keren]] to capture [[Keren, Eritrea]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: General [[Douglas MacArthur]] returns to [[Manila]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; The [[Chondoist Chongu Party]] is founded in [[North Korea]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[Gamel Abdel Nasser]] is nominated to be the first president of the [[United Arab Republic]].
*  1958   &ndash; A [[hydrogen bomb]] known as the [[Tybee Bomb]] is lost by the [[United States Air Force|US Air Force]] off the coast of [[Savannah, Georgia]], never to be recovered.
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[President of the French Republic|French President]] [[Charles de Gaulle]] calls for [[Algeria]] to be granted independence.
*[[1963]] &ndash; The [[European Court of Justice]]'s ruling in ''[[Van Gend en Loos v Nederlandse Administratie der Belastingen]]'' establishes the principle of [[direct effect]], one of the most important, if not the most important, decisions in the development of [[European Union law]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; Astronauts land on the moon in the [[Apollo 14]] mission.
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Bob Douglas]] becomes the first [[African American]] elected to the [[Basketball Hall of Fame]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; Riots break in [[Lima|Lima, Peru]] after the police forces go on strike [[February 4|the day before]]. The uprising (locally known as the ''Limazo'') is bloodily suppressed by the military dictatorship.
*[[1976]] &ndash; The [[1976 swine flu outbreak]] begins at Fort Dix, NJ.
*[[1985]] &ndash; Ugo Vetere, then the mayor of [[Rome]], and [[Chedli Klibi]], then the mayor of [[Carthage]] meet in [[Tunis]] to sign a treaty of friendship officially ending the [[Third Punic War]] which lasted 2,131 years.
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Manuel Noriega]] is indicted on [[Illegal drug trade|drug smuggling]] and [[money laundering]] charges.
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Byron De La Beckwith]] is convicted of the 1963 murder of [[civil rights]] leader [[Medgar Evers]].
*  1994   &ndash; During the [[war in Bosnia and Herzegovina]] more than 60 people are killed and some 200 wounded as a mortar shell slams into a downtown marketplace in [[Sarajevo]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; The so-called [[Swiss bank#Major banks|Big Three banks]] in [[Switzerland]] announce the creation of a $71&nbsp;million fund to aid [[The Holocaust|Holocaust]] survivors and their families.
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Russia]]n forces [[Novye Aldi massacre|massacre]] at least 60 civilians in the Novye Aldi suburb of [[Grozny]], [[Chechnya]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Rebellion|Rebels]] from the [[National Revolutionary Front for the Liberation of Haiti|Revolutionary Artibonite Resistance Front]] capture the city of [[Gonaïves]], starting the [[2004 Haiti rebellion]].
*[[2008]] &ndash; A [[2008 Super Tuesday tornado outbreak|major tornado outbreak]] across the [[Southern United States]] kills 57.
